ygData.messageBody:
<Arkansas Drawl> I Feel your pain </Arkansas Drawl>

Put that up there with: (at early 20's)

"Play the mana Song"
(Then the bard launches into a long explanation that the "Mana Song" comes
at 32 and why Jig of Vigor doesn't really increase mana and why it seems to
increase mana)

"Okay, but play the mana song"....

My advise (probably obvious but worth stating) is to join a guild - where
you can explain these things to people who hopefully will be intelligent
enough to understand what we're doing...

Back to the Jig topic - it's amazing how many people still insist that it
speeds mana. I was in a group with a 31 Bard who argued with me - that he
tested it. He tested it by timing how long it took for the casters to get
full mana after a battle. When I asked if the casters always made sure they
used up their mana - his response "What difference would that make?"

Another case I was with another bard - and a Druid. I asked the Bard why he
was doing Jig? Because the Druid asked him. I told the Druid that it
didn't (the usual blah-blah-blah). Her response (I can't remember exact
words - but to the affect) - She had a 41 level Bard character - so she
obviously knew more about it than I did (I was level 27 at the time).
(Pardon me for having a life!)

Back to your initial complaint.. You were in a no-win situation - if you
tried to point out their flawed thinking - you would have looked like sour
grapes. Those people were especially ignorant - given that since Anthem
doesn't stack - you couldn't have been doing what he was if you wanted to!

Anyway - good luck to you - and hopefully you'll find better groups!

Slyde
